intro: Eriogonum deflexum subsp. ultrum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky, dry habitats such as slopes and meadows. The plant features small, clustered white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Eriogonum deflexum subsp. ultrum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
